topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1 and 1.1.1: Cinder Ceph Storage

titlealts.searchtitle: HPE Helion Openstack 1.1: Cinder Ceph Storage

body.p: The following steps are automatically performed when you download and execute Ceph_client script from the controller and compute nodes as per the readme file in the tar file.

ol.li:
Verify the Ceph health by entering:ceph health
Output:HEALTH_OK

Create a new pool for the Cinder volume by entering:ceph osd pool create <cinder pool name> <pg-num>
For example:ceph osd pool create helion-ceph-cinder 100

To verify a new pool creation, enter:rados lspools
Output:rbd ls helion-ceph-cinder

Create symbolic or softlinks to the relevant files on overcloud controller nodes by entering:ln -s /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/rados* /opt/stack/venvs/openstack/lib/python2.7/site-packages/. ln -s /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/rbd* /opt/stack/venvs/openstack/lib/python2.7/site-packages/.

section.title: Configuring Cinder
section.p: HPE Helion OpenStack requires the rbd driver to interact with Ceph block devices. The pool name must be specified for the block device. To specify the pool name on the overcloud controller nodes edit cinder.conf.
Perform the following steps to configure Cinder.

ol.li:
Edit /etc/cinder/cinder.conf and add the following:[DEFAULT]
# For ceph integration volume_driver=cinder.volume.drivers.rbd.RBDDriver rbd_pool=helion-ceph-cinder rbd_ceph_conf=/etc/ceph/ceph.conf rbd_flatten_volume_from_snapshot=false rbd_max_clone_depth=5
You can also insert a comment on the lvm backend in the cinder.conf file for your reference.# LVM thin provision. This way we do not dd the disk
#enabled_backends = lvm-1
Restart the Cinder service by entering:service cinder-volume restart service cinder-scheduler restart service cinder-api restart

section.p: Once the cinder service is restarted, you can create a volume.

section.title: Helion OpenStack Cinder Backup Ceph Storage
section.p: The Ceph backup driver performs the data backup operation on the volume to a Ceph RADOS Block Device (RBD). Backups can be performed between different Ceph pools and Ceph clusters. This section explains the backup and restore procedure for Cinder volumes.

On the Helion controller and compute node, if the Ceph client softwares are successfully installed and the Ceph configuration and keyring files are copied in the Helion controller and compute nodes, then the HPE Helion OpenStack Ceph Configuration service performs the following steps:

ol.li:
Verify Ceph health status by entering:ceph health
Output:HEALTH_OK

Create a new pool for Cinder backup by entering:ceph osd pool create <cinder backup pool name> <pg-num>
For example:ceph osd pool create helion-ceph-backups 100

To verify that a new backup pool is created, enter:rados lspools
Output:rbd ls helion-ceph-backups

Create symbolic or softlinks to the relevant files on overcloud controller nodes (if the following links are already created for other services, then ignore them) by entering:ln -s /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/rados* /opt/stack/venvs/openstack/lib/python2.7/site-packages/.
ln -s /usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/rbd* /opt/stack/venvs/openstack/lib/python2.7/site-packages/.

section.title: Configuring Cinder backup
section.p: Perform the following steps to enable the Ceph backup driver:

ol.li:
Edit /etc/cinder/cinder.conf and add the following options in all three controller nodes [OCC mgmt, OCC0, OCC1].[DEFAULT]
# For cinder backup backup_driver=cinder.backup.drivers.ceph backup_ceph_conf=/etc/ceph/ceph.conf backup_ceph_user=cinder-backup backup_ceph_chunk_size=134217728 backup_ceph_pool=helion-ceph-backups backup_ceph_stripe_unit=0 backup_ceph_stripe_count=0 restore_discard_excess_bytes=true
The following table provides the description of the parameters.
Parameters Descriptions
backup_ceph_chunk_size = 134217728 The chunk size, in bytes, that a backup is broken into before transfer to the Ceph object store.
backup_ceph_conf = /etc/ceph/ceph.conf Ceph configuration file to use.
backup_ceph_pool = helion-ceph-backups The Ceph pool where volume backups are stored.
backup_ceph_stripe_count = 0 RBD stripe count to use when creating a backup image.
backup_ceph_stripe_unit = 0 RBD stripe unit to use when creating a backup image.
backup_ceph_user = cinder The Ceph user to connect with. Default here is to use the same user as for Cinder volumes. If not using cephx this should be set to None.
restore_discard_excess_bytes = True If True, always discard excess bytes when restoring volumes (that is, pad with zeroes).
Restart the Cinder service by entering:service cinder-backup restart
